articles.title: Tomb Raider: Sophie Turner Does Her Own Stunt In New BTS Lara Croft Pics
articles.title_tr: Tomb Raider: Sophie Turner Does Her Own Stunt In New BTS Lara Croft Pics
articles.summary: Earlier this year, Prime Video shared a first look at Game of Thrones' Sophie Turner as the new Lara Croft from the upcoming Tomb Raider series. Now, Turner has been spotted behind thescenes doing a stunt worthy of Lara herself.The Daily Mail has published numerous photos of Turner in costume as Lara Croft while performing a parachute stunt for the show. For this particular scene, Turner was wearing full-body tactical gear that would have made it easier for a stunt person to fill in for her. Instead, she's there on set doing it herself.The @DailyMail has published 12 photos from the set of Amazon Prime Videoâ€™s Tomb Raider series, also showing Sophie Turner as Lara Croft in tactical gear during the filming of a parachute-landing scene! ğŸª‚ pic.twitter.com/zFEFhVUMxg  â€” Infinity Tomb Raider (@infinityTRaider) February 6, 2026              During an interview in January, Turner noted that she underwent extensive physical training in order to believably portray the video game heroine previously played by Angelina Jolie and Alicia Vikander on the big screen. Turner also shared her pride at the way Lara will be characterized on the show.Continue Reading at GameSpot

articles.title: Overwatch's New Hero Jetpack Cat Has A Legendary Voice Actor Purr-Forming The Meows
articles.title_tr: Overwatch's New Hero Jetpack Cat Has A Legendary Voice Actor Purr-Forming The Meows
articles.summary: Jennifer Hale--most famously known for Commander Shepard in the Mass Effect trilogy--has been confirmed to voice Jetpack Cat in Overwatch. The flying feline is one of five new heroes coming to the game on February 10 for The Reign of Talon, Season 1.The Express Tribune reported that Hale will be providing the meows for Jetpack Cat in the newly renamed game, which is now just Overwatch by ditching the 2. The title change is part of a major overhaul of the online FPS. As for Hale (who also voices Ashe in the game), Overwatch audio and technical director Scott Lawson stated that "she did an incredible job, and working with it was so much fun." On X, Hale also expressed her excitement about voicing Jetpack Cat.The support character can heal and tow allies from the sky, thanks to the obvious jetpack. As for Jetpack Cat's ultimate ability, called Catnapper, the hero can plunge down to disrupt opponents, then tether one to throw off a ledge, for instance.Continue Reading at GameSpot
